productTitle: HP Victus Gaming Laptop, 12th Gen Intel Core i5-12450H, 4GB RTX 3050 GPU, 15.6-inch (39.6 cm) FHD IPS 144Hz, 16GB DDR4, 512GB SSD, Backlit KB, B&O Dual Speakers (Win 11, MSO, Blue, 2.37 kg), fa0666TX
Review Title: Short battery life & poor performance; delayed customer support.
Review Body: I recently purchased the HP Victus Gaming Laptop from Amazon, and I must say I am thoroughly disappointed with my purchase. I had high hopes for this gaming laptop, but it has fallen far short of my expectations.First and foremost, the battery life is abysmal. I expected a laptop with decent battery performance, but I can barely get it to last for more than 2 hours of simple usage. It's incredibly frustrating to have to constantly be tethered to a power source when I had hoped to use it on the go. This severely limits its portability and functionality.Moreover, the laptop's performance is far from what I anticipated. With its 12th Gen Intel Core i5-12450H and NVIDIA RTX 3050 GPU, I expected smooth gaming and multitasking capabilities. However, I've experienced significant lag and performance issues that make it nearly impossible to enjoy gaming or perform tasks efficiently. It's disheartening to invest in a so-called gaming laptop and have it struggle with even the most basic of tasks.Adding to my disappointment, I've tried reaching out to Amazon's customer service team for assistance with these problems, but they have yet to arrive at my home after two weeks of waiting. The lack of timely customer support is incredibly frustrating and adds to the overall negative experience.In conclusion, the HP Victus Gaming Laptop has been a letdown in every aspect. The short battery life, poor performance, and lack of effective customer support have made this purchase a regrettable one. I would not recommend this product to anyone, and I'm left feeling unsatisfied and frustrated with my Amazon shopping experience.

Review Body: The worst thing about this laptop!"Wrong Power button placing"There is no space for 2.5 inch HDD. Also there is no second m.2 slot. So you can only use a second storage through USB. Games need a lot of space hence this being a gaming laptop is at a disadvantage.Ram expansion only upto16 GB. And lesser battery capacity.And as it is a gaming laptop, its battery backup is only 2 hours.the fan placing at the bottom is only single side, if they have placing both sides like Asus Predator , then the air flow would have been very good for cooling.Cooling system also bad.There is no light on the number lock button, so sometimes there is confusion whether it is on or off?Go for other laptop which are better then hp victus.

Review Body: Features:Processor: 12th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-12450H 2.00 GHzDisplay: Typically comes with a Full HD (1920x1080) IPS display, offering vibrant colors and wide viewing angles.Graphics: Integrated Intel Iris Xe Graphics or dedicated NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650/3050 (depending on the variant).RAM: Options for 8GB or 16GB DDR4, upgradable.Storage: SSD options starting from 256GB, upgradable to 1TBAdvantages:Performance: Strong performance for a mid-range laptop, thanks to the 12th Gen Intel i5 processor.Display: Good display quality with Full HD resolution and IPS technology.Upgradeability: Easy to upgrade RAM and storage.Keyboard: Comfortable, backlit keyboard ideal for typing in low-light conditions.Port Selection: A wide range of ports ensures good connectivity optionsDisadvantagesBuild Quality: While decent, the plastic build might not feel as premium as other laptops in its price range.Thermals and Noise: Can get warm and loud under load.Battery Life: Might not meet the advertised 6-8 hours for all users, especially under heavy use.Weight: Slightly heavier than some competitors, impacting portability.Value for Money:The HP Victus laptop with a 12th Gen Intel Core i5-12450H offers a solid balance of performance, features, and affordability. Priced competitively, it provides good value for students, professionals, and casual gamers who need a reliable machine for everyday tasks and moderate multitasking. While there are minor drawbacks in build quality and battery life, the performance and feature set generally outweigh these cons.

Review Body: I recently bought  the HP Vitus i5, and I must say, it exceeded my expectations in several ways.Performance-wise, the Intel i5 processor  gives a  smooth and responsive experience, whether I'm multitasking between work applications .The 16GB of RAM ensures that I can run multiple programs simultaneously without noticeable  lag.It has 15.6-inch display , making it enjoyable to watch movies or edit photos.The battery is pretty good in single time charge  , allowing me to work for extended periods without constantly needing to plug in which stands upto 6 hours .In terms of connectivity,it includes  USB-C, HDMI, and SD card slots, making it easy to connect to external devices such as monitors or printers.Overall,if you are student it is  Highly recommended!

productTitle: HP Victus Gaming Laptop, 12th Gen Intel Core i5-12450H, 4GB RTX 3050 GPU, 15.6-inch (39.6 cm) FHD IPS 144Hz, 16GB DDR4, 512GB SSD, Backlit KB, B&O Dual Speakers (Win 11, MSO, Blue, 2.37 kg), fa0666TX
Review Body: I am using this laptop from 8 to 9 month .The overall performance of the laptop is very good it give me 100 + FPS in games like GTA v for cry 6 ,valorent goes to 200 to 300 FPS in highest graphics settings.The problems I faced with this product are : 1. There are some issue with my device in my case the RAM is faulty due to which the game leg and suddenly shutdown but I complaint about it on HP customer care and within a week day test and replace my RAM and then my PC works really well they also gave clean up to my PC and change the coolant.2. And there was issue in my window 11.3. USB ports are only two so you have to buy a for USB hub or any type of hub.4. Camera and mic sucks you have to use external mic and camera.Good things :1. Temperature does not reach above than 90¬∞ C with a cooling pad but I also suggest to use laptop in AC room or infront of coolar or a fan .2. Wobling is not an issue I use my laptop in front of a cooler on a high speed and the screen does not shake a little bit but when you slightly touch the laptop it moves a little bit and it is mandatory to use laptop when the lead is open.3. Gaming experience is quite good and I have no complaint about it I run high and FPS shooting games and high graphic games on it and softwares like unreal engine, Android studio, Da vinci's resolve etc4. Last thing is about their customer care you have to wait for some time on call in my case it take an hour but the solution they give about my problems solve it instantly and for any hardware aur software issue the engineer from HP customer care came to your home repair your PC in front of your eyes in  the engineer from HP customer care came to your home repair your PC in front of your eyes in front  the engineer from HP customer care came to your home repair your PC in front of you oh sometime day take it with them and give it back to you in 2 to 3 days in my case it take 2 days and my PC is completely repaired so I highly suggest you to increase your warranty at the time you buy and check that the warranty was increased by HP itself not by Amazon or any other e-commerce website.###worth it laptop for all category of students and gamers###
